title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Due to the influence of the active southwest monsoon weather condition, showery weather over the Western, and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Nuwara-Eliya and Kandy districts is likely to enhance during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology says.

title: Another three suspects arrested over shooting of Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle
byline: Three individuals, including the motorcyclist involved in the shooting incident targeting the vehicle of former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa, and two others have been arrested by the Colombo Range Crime Division, Sri Lanka Police said.

title: Miss World 2025 set for grand finale on May 31 after a month long rigorous challenges
byline: Hyderabad is poised to host the Miss World 2025 Grand Finale on May 31, 2025, at the Hyderabad International Exhibition Centre (HITEX), marking its the third time India hosting the prestigious pageant after 1996 and 2024.

title: US stops scheduling visa interviews for foreign students while it expands social media vetting
byline: The State Department has halted the scheduling of new visa interviews for foreign students hoping to study in the U.S. while it prepares to expand the screening of their activity on social media, officials said.

title: Due to prevailing social stigma about menstruation, many women suffer in silence: PM Harini
byline: The Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that many women silently endure pain and distress due to the societal stigma about menstruation, which is a completely natural biological process and emphasized the need to address this matter to protect women from this situation.

title: 450kg of narcotics found in two vessels taken into custody in southern seas
byline: Around 450kg of narcotics including heroin and crystal methamphetamine (ICE) have been found in the two multi-day fishing vessels detained in the deep seas off Sri Lanka’s southern coast yesterday (27).

title: Harry Potter TV series reveals new Harry, Ron, and Hermione
byline: HBO has announced the young actors who will play the lead trio in its TV series adaption of JK Rowling’s book series, Harry Potter.

title: Hearing of case against ‘Harak Kata’ fixed for 9 June
byline: The Colombo High Court today (28) ordered the case filed against three individuals, including notorious underworld figure Nadun Chithaka Wickremeratne, alias ‘Harak Kata’, who are accused of conspiring to escape from the custody of the Criminal Investigation Department, be taken up on 9 June.

title: Over 400 families in eight districts affected due to adverse weather
byline: Over 400 families in eight districts have been affected owing to adverse weather conditions experienced across the country in recent days.

title: Vraie Balthazaar will be Colombo Mayor – Minister Lal Kantha
byline: Vraie Cally Balthazaar will be the Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council, according to the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation, K.D. Lal Kantha.

title: 36-hour water cut for several areas in Kandy
byline: A 36-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas in Kandy from 2:00 p.m. today (28), the Office of the Municipal Commissioner of the Kandy Municipal Council has announced.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in four districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued for multiple areas in four districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: SpaceX’s Starship spins out of control after flying past points of previous failures
byline: SpaceX’s Starship rocket roared into space from Texas on Tuesday but spun out of control about halfway through its flight without achieving some of its most important testing goals, bringing fresh engineering hurdles to CEO Elon Musk’s increasingly turbulent Mars rocket program.

title: Japan bans ‘flashy’ baby names like Pikachu, Pudding
byline: Japan has introduced rules to prevent parents from giving their children “flashy” names.

title: Duminda Dissanayake returns to Magazine Prison
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake, who was previously remanded and transferred to the prison hospital for medical treatment, has been sent back to the Magazine Prison.

title: Postal workers to launch token strike from midnight
byline: Postal workers across the country will launch a token strike at midnight today (28), the Union of Post and Telecommunication Officers has announced.

title: ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit allowances of over 70s for May credited
byline: The “Aswesuma” welfare benefit allowances for this month (May) for those above the age of 70 years have been credited to the beneficiaries’ bank accounts today (28), the Welfare Benefits Board has announced.

title: Deshabandu to appear before inquiry committee today
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon is scheduled to appear before the three-member committee of inquiry, appointed to investigate and report on allegations of misconduct and serious abuse of office against him, today (28).

title: Vehicular movement along Avissawella - Kegalle road restricted due to fallen tree
byline: Vehicular movement along Avissawella - Kegalle main road has been restricted in Magammana, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: China’s BYD gains ground in Sri Lanka’s auto market
byline: BYD, a Chinese new energy vehicle (NEV) maker, is expanding its footprint in Sri Lanka with plans to introduce DENZA, its premium luxury brand, through local distributor John Keells CG Auto.

title: Three sluice gates of Polgolla Reservoir opened due to heavy rains
byline: Three sluice gates of the Polgolla Reservoir in Kandy have been opened due to heavy rainfall.

title: No turning back on steps taken toward social progress –President
byline: There is no turning back on the steps taken toward social progress, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says.

title: Arijit Singh to become first Indian artist to headline UK Stadium
byline: Singer Arijit Singh is all set to make history as the first Indian artist to headline a UK stadium, with a live show scheduled for September 5, 2025, at London’s iconic Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

title: Drug haul seized from two fishing vessels estimated to be over 600kg
byline: The haul of narcotics found in the two multi-day fishing trawlers detained in deep seas off Sri Lanka’s southern coast yesterday (27), has now been estimated to be over 600 kilograms, the Sri Lanka Navy said.

title: Sri Lanka’s Anudi among top 20 finalists in Miss World Multimedia Challenge
byline: Anudi Gunasekara of Sri Lanka has earned a prestigious place among the Top 20 finalists in the Multimedia Challenge at the 72nd Miss World Festival in Telangana, India.

title: US and Russia clash in public as the Ukraine war heats up
byline: The United States and Russia quarrelled in public on Wednesday over the intensifying Ukraine war after U.S. President Donald Trump warned that President Vladimir Putin was “playing with fire” and Moscow massed 50,000 troops near a Ukrainian region.

title: Members must abide by party’s decisions –SJB seniors
byline: Regardless of any issues that may have arisen, party members must agree with the decisions made by the party, according to a group of senior members of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

title: Special discussion held on sudden closure of ‘NEXT’ apparel factory in Katunayake
byline: A special discussion regarding the sudden closure of the ‘NEXT’ apparel factory located within the Free Trade Zone (FTZ) in Katunayake was held, with the intervention of Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe.

title: SC to hear petitions filed challenging Deshabandu’s appointment as IGP
byline: The Supreme Court today (28) ordered that the petitions filed, seeking a ruling that the appointment of Deshabandu Tennakoon as the Inspector General of Police (IGP) allegedly without the formal approval of the Constitutional Council is unconstitutional, will be taken up for hearing on 8 September, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: President holds talks to develop long-term strategy to strengthen Sri Lanka’s export sector
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held discussions with stakeholders on the pressing challenges currently affecting the export-oriented industrial sector and explored potential solutions to address them effectively.

title: Sri Lanka’s Kalinga Kumarage secures bronze at Asian Athletics Championships
byline: Kalinga Kumarage of Sri Lanka secured the bronze medal in the Men’s 400m event at the 26th Asian Athletics Championships currently being held in South Korea.

title: Cost of living in Sri Lanka has doubled since 2021 – CBSL
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) states that the cost of living for individuals in the country has doubled compared to 2021.

title: Polish FM arrives in Sri Lanka on official visit
byline: Radosław Sikorski, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Poland, in the context of Poland’s Presidency of the Council of the European Union, has arrived in Sri Lanka on an official visit.

title: Drug haul seized from two fishing vessels estimated to be over 778kg
byline: The haul of narcotics found in the two multi-day fishing trawlers detained in deep seas off Sri Lanka’s southern coast yesterday (27), has now been estimated to be over 600 kilograms, the Sri Lanka Navy said.

title: Asian Athletics C’ships: Sri Lanka wins bronze in 4x400m Mixed Relay
byline: Sri Lanka secured a bronze medal in the 4x400m Mixed Relay event at the 26th Asian Athletics Championships currently being held in South Korea.

title: Track damage at Maligawatta Yard causes train delays
byline: All trains departing from the Maligawatta Railway Yard will be delayed, the Department of Railways said.

title: Shooting of Thusitha Halloluwa’s vehicle: 3 suspects to be detained for 24 hours
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (28) granted permission to detain and question the three individuals arrested yesterday over the shooting incident targeting the vehicle of former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, for 24 hours, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Muslims in Sri Lanka to celebrate Hajj festival on June 7
byline: Muslims in Sri Lanka will celebrate the Hajj festival (Eid al-Adha) on 7 June, the Colombo Grand Mosque has announced.

title: Assets worth Rs. 100 million linked to notorious cannabis trafficker suspended
byline: The Illegal Assets Investigation Division of Sri Lanka Police today (28) suspended assets worth around Rs. 100 million belonging to J.A. Jayasinghe, alias ‘Bathala Heenmahattaya’ — a resident of Embilipitiya, who is suspected by security forces to be the largest cannabis trafficker in the country.

title: BASL files petition over Sabaragamuwa Uni. ragging incident
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has filed a Fundamental Rights Petition before the Supreme Court, seeking a ruling that the ragging incident involving Charith Dilshan

title: 12 spots filled: Who will complete the Miss World 2025 top 40?
byline: The countdown to Miss World 2025 finals has begun as 40 contestants, including fast-track winners and judge selections from around the world, prepare to compete in Telengana, Hyderabad.
